articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he was counting on Ukrainian and European unity and U.S. pragmatism as Kyiv faces a mounting crisis in relations with its hitherto key U.S. ally.
articles.title: Zelenskiy calls for US pragmatism after Trump calls him a 'dictator'

articles.author: John Geddie, Tim Kelly, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: When President Donald Trump sat down to lunch with his Japanese counterpart this month, talk turned quickly to how Tokyo could help realise a decades-old proposal to unlock gas in Alaska and ship it to U.S. allies in Asia.
articles.title: Trump seeks to reshape Asia's energy supplies with US gas

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israel braced on Thursday for the return of the bodies of infant Kfir Bibas and his four-year-old brother Ariel, the two youngest captives taken by Hamas in their Oct. 7, 2023 attack and among the most potent symbols of the trauma inflicted that day.
articles.title: Israel prepares to receive bodies of youngest Gaza hostages

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean police are formally building a case against impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol over accusations he obstructed the execution of an arrest warrant, a police spokesperson said on Friday.
articles.title: South Korea police say building case against Yoon for obstructing arrest

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A possible meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin "will largely depend on whether we can make any progress on ending the war in Ukraine," U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Thursday.
articles.title: Trump, Putin meeting depends on progress toward ending Ukraine war, says Rubio

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Costa Rica's government received its first group of mostly Asian migrants deported from the United States on Thursday, part of a deal with Washington to temporarily house up to 200 deportees from other nations.
articles.title: Group of mostly Asian migrants deported from US arrive in Costa Rica

articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: China came out in support of U.S. President Donald Trump's bid to strike a deal with Russia to end the war in Ukraine, at a G20 meeting in South Africa on Thursday, while U.S. allies rallied around Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
articles.title: China backs Trump's Ukraine peace bid at G20 as US allies rally behind Zelenskiy

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Emma Farge, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: The U.S. is refusing to co-sponsor a draft U.N. resolution marking three years since Moscow's invasion of Ukraine that backs Kyiv's territorial integrity and condemns Russian aggression, in a potential stark shift by Ukraine's most powerful Western ally.
articles.title: Exclusive: US will not co-sponsor UN motion backing Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk, the billionaire tasked with slashing U.S. federal government spending, took to the stage at a conservative conference outside Washington on Thursday with a gift from Argentina's libertarian President Javier Milei: a chainsaw.
articles.title: Elon Musk wields chainsaw at conservative gathering, a gift from Argentina's Milei

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain's High Court said on Thursday it had found former soccer federation boss Luis Rubiales guilty of sexual assault for kissing player Jenni Hermoso without her consent, and set a fine of over 10,000 euros ($10,434.00), but acquitted him of coercion.
articles.title: Spanish court sentences ex-soccer boss Rubiales to pay fine over kiss without consent
